source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers Accidental Death, Permanent Disablement and Third Degree Burns.
War Cover extension applies: Covers Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement as an innocent bystander during war.

base_limits.type: Physiotherapist, Chinese Physician or Chiropractor ($50 per visit)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers outpatient and hospitalisation medical expenses incurred overseas arising from accident or sickness, emergency dental expenses arising from accident, and accidental miscarriage.

coverages.coverage_name: Medical Expenses Incurred Upon Return to Singapore

base_limits.type: Physiotherapist, Chinese Physician or Chiropractor ($50 per visit)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers follow-up treatment within 31 days from return date. If initial treatment was not sought overseas, treatment in Singapore must be sought within 48 hours from return date and covered for up to 31 days.

coverages.coverage_name: Emergency Medical Evacuation & Repatriation (Including Mortal Remains) Back to Singapore

base_limits.type: Per Insured Person up to 70 years

limits.type: Per Insured Person up to 70 years

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Provides cover for emergency medical evacuation and repatriation back to Singapore, including mortal remains. Includes pregnancy-related complications. Pre-existing medical conditions are not covered under the Vital plan.
Payable for each complete day you are hospitalised overseas.

coverages.coverage_name: Compassionate Visit by a Relative or Friend

base_limits.type: Due to your injury, sickness or disease - Per Insured Person
Due to your injury, sickness or disease - Per Family
In the event of your death - Per Insured Person
In the event of your death - Per Family

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers travel and accommodation expenses for one relative or friend to travel to you if you are hospitalised overseas due to injury/sickness/disease, or in the event of your death.

coverages.coverage_name: Loss or Damage to Baggage & Personal Effects

base_limits.type: Per video equipment, camera, batteries and lenses item
Per laptop computer or tablet device

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers loss or damage to your baggage and personal effects during the trip. Section (C) sub-limits apply.

base_limits.type: Loss of money resulting from theft
Fraudulent use of credit card overseas

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers loss of essential travel documents and loss of cash or money orders due to theft. Also covers fraudulent use of your credit card if lost or stolen during the trip. Section (F) sub-limits apply for money loss.
Covers non-refundable travel/accommodation costs if trip is cancelled or postponed due to Insured Events occurring within 30 days before departure. Includes loss of frequent flyer points.
Covers loss of un-utilised portion of prepaid travel costs and expenses after trip departure arising from Insured Events resulting in your necessary return to Singapore.

coverages.coverage_name: Financial Collapse of Licensed Tour Operators

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Covers loss of non-refundable or un-utilised prepaid travel costs and expenses for trip cancellation or curtailment due to insolvency or financial collapse of the licensed tour operator, travel agent, airline or other travel provider, occurring after the date of issue of policy.
Covers legal liability for accidental injury to third parties or accidental damage to third party property.

Pays a cash benefit for delay in arrival of checked-in baggage for every full 6 consecutive hours. Extended to cover delay as a result of your baggage being wrongly picked up at the bag carousel by another passenger whilst overseas.

base_limits.type: Per Insured Person (Overseas, after first 6 hours)

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a cash benefit for delay of scheduled public conveyance for every full 6 consecutive hours due to any cause outside your control. Payout based on actual arrival time vs original scheduled arrival time.
Pays a cash benefit if you are denied boarding on a confirmed scheduled flight whilst overseas due to overbooking and no alternative transport is made available within 6 hours.

Pays a cash benefit for every 6 full consecutive hours of delay resulting from flight deviation due to (a) adverse weather conditions; or (b) landing at an alternative destination for emergency medical treatment of a fellow passenger.
Pays a cash benefit if you miss a connecting scheduled public conveyance due to the late arrival of your incoming confirmed connecting conveyance, and no alternative is available within 6 hours.
Provides Personal Accident cover (Accidental Death & Permanent Disablement) if sustained as an innocent bystander due to acts of war.
Pays for necessary additional accommodation expenses if your pre-booked accommodation is cancelled after the trip has commenced due to specified insured events (e.g., natural disaster, fire).
Reimburses emergency telephone calls made necessary by an event covered under the policy.

coverages.coverage_name: Quarantine Allowance Due to 17 Infectious Diseases Upon Return to Singapore

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Pays a daily cash benefit if you are required to be quarantined upon return to Singapore due to exposure to one of the 17 specified infectious diseases (SARS, Dengue, vCJD, Nipah, JE, Malaria, TB, Measles, Rabies, Melioidosis, HFMD, Avian Flu (H1N1, H5N1, H9N2, H7N7, H7N9), Chikungunya, Mumps, Rubella, MERS, Zika).

The Vital plan does not appear to include specific cover for amateur sports like tandem skydiving, hang-gliding, paragliding, snow-skiing, hot-air ballooning, bungee jumping, indoor rock climbing, or trekking up to 3,500m, as described on Page 2. Leisure Underwater Activities cover is also explicitly Not Applicable (N.A.) on Page 5, Section 28.

coverages.coverage_name: Free and Automatic Extension of Policy

source_specific_details.detail_snippet: Policy may be automatically extended for up to 14 days if return to Singapore is prevented by injury/illness/quarantine or delayed/cancellation of public conveyance beyond your control.

Insured must be Singaporean, PR, or Foreigner with valid pass (EP, WP, DP, SP, LTVP) residing in Singapore. Child definition: below 21 (or 25 if full-time student), dependent, unmarried, not employed. Max single trip duration 182 days, max annual multi-trip duration 90 days per trip. Policy must be purchased before departure.
Pre-existing medical conditions are generally not covered. Emergency Medical Evacuation & Repatriation explicitly excludes cover for pre-existing conditions under the Vital plan.
